instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.ADAPTER_EN: What is ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.C1802: What is C1802? Capacitor to ground on PCH_SRTCRST_L on machines from 2009-2012, PCH_SRTCRST_L needs to be high for PCH to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .
definitions.C1803: What is C1803? Capacitor to ground on RTC_RESET_L on machines from 2009-2012, RTC_RESET_L needs to be high for system to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi.

No fan spin whatsoever.

Present rails.

PPBUS
PP3V42
<SIGNAL>PP5VIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER</SIGNAL>
PPDCIN
PPRTC G3H
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> Diode mode .480V

Liquid damage heavy around <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>, J2550 area, T29 Area and Codec Area. Replaced burnt corroded components around <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>. Started to replace stuff on the other areas but not sure if they are relevant to get power. Dont want to do all that work just to find out the thing is shot. Its been kind of my M.O. lately.
Also, some very light white shit (almost looks like salt) around bottom of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> pins and some surrounding areas. Doesnt look green, burnt or caked at all though.

Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Heavy corrosion around <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> is usually fatal as there are a bunch of probe points that are directly on a via. Post picture please.

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Had to change profile due to paypal. Heres pics . [URL]https://photos.app.goo.gl/KOi8z3Co0UkbwC0D2[/URL]
It is pretty bad all around. Replaced everything but the 2 large caps and <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> itself. Didnt really mess too much with J2550 area. Wasnt sure how important it was for now.

Thanks Duke.

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I don't know man. This is one of those boards that will probably have multiple failures. When you fix the power issue it will have MUX issues. When you fix the MUX the GPU will die next month. Honestly I would never have touched a board like this.

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I see. Well its not really a rush. Where can I start for <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL>? I will worry about he other shit as it comes. It will be a project board I guess.  Thanks Duke. Later.

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: No <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL> could be anything. Using 85W charger? <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> present? PPBUS voltage? Does a battery charge?

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Orange light on charger with Batt connected. PPBUS is 12.56V. 85 W Charger. <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.4V. Thanks.

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: 32KHz from clock chip, crap under PCH? PPVRTC? Voltage on <CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR>/03?

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: PPVRTC - 3.3V, <CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR> - 3.3V, <CAPACITOR>C1803</CAPACITOR> - 3.3V. I dont have a way of measuring frequency so no idea on pin 12 <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>. PCH looks normal but I cant be sure cause I cant see under it without removing it.

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: It could be anything from PCH to SMC. Checked all rails for shorts?

threads.title: Liquid damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Not all. Stopped when I saw I was missing <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>. Will do.

Ok man... Have a good day.
